title: Classic Spaghetti Carbonara
description: A traditional Italian pasta dish made with eggs, cheese, pancetta, and black pepper. Creamy, savory, and absolutely delicious!

instructions.instruction: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Cook spaghetti according to package directions until al dente.
While pasta cooks, cut pancetta into small cubes and cook in a large skillet over medium heat until crispy, about 8 minutes.
In a bowl, whisk together egg yolks, grated Pecorino Romano, and black pepper.
Reserve 1 cup pasta water, then drain the spaghetti.
Remove skillet from heat. Add hot pasta to the pancetta and toss.
Quickly pour egg mixture over pasta, tossing constantly. Add pasta water as needed to create a creamy sauce.
Serve immediately with extra cheese and pepper on top.

title: Fluffy Blueberry Pancakes
description: Light and fluffy pancakes loaded with fresh blueberries. Perfect for a weekend breakfast!

instructions.instruction: In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk buttermilk, eggs, and melted butter.
Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients and stir until just combined. Do not overmix.
Gently fold in blueberries.
Heat a griddle or non-stick pan over medium heat. Lightly grease with butter.
Pour 1/4 cup batter per pancake. Cook until bubbles form on surface, then flip.
Cook until golden brown. Serve with maple syrup and extra blueberries.

title: Thai Green Curry
description: Aromatic and spicy Thai green curry with chicken and vegetables in creamy coconut milk.

instructions.instruction: Heat 1/2 cup coconut milk in a wok over medium-high heat until oil separates.
Add green curry paste and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Add chicken and cook until no longer pink on the outside.
Pour in remaining coconut milk and bring to a simmer.
Add eggplant, bamboo shoots, and bell peppers. Cook for 10 minutes.
Season with fish sauce and palm sugar. Add kaffir lime leaves.
Remove from heat, stir in Thai basil, and serve with jasmine rice.

title: Classic Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Crispy on the edges, chewy in the middle - these chocolate chip cookies are absolutely perfect!

instructions.instruction: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Line baking sheets with parchment paper.
Whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt in a bowl.
Beat butter and both sugars until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes.
Beat in eggs one at a time, then add vanilla.
Gradually mix in flour mixture until just combined.
Fold in chocolate chips.
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto prepared baking sheets.
Bake for 10-12 minutes until edges are golden. Cool on pan for 5 minutes.

title: Fresh Garden Salad
description: A light and refreshing salad with mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, cucumbers, and a zesty lemon vinaigrette.

instructions.instruction: Wash and dry all vegetables thoroughly.
In a large bowl, combine mixed greens, tomatoes, cucumber, and red onion.
In a small jar, combine olive oil, lemon juice, Dijon mustard, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Shake vigorously until well combined.
Drizzle dressing over salad just before serving and toss gently.

title: Creamy Tomato Soup
description: A comforting bowl of creamy tomato soup, perfect for dipping grilled cheese sandwiches!

instructions.instruction: Melt butter in a large pot over medium heat. Sauté onion until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add tomatoes, vegetable broth, sugar, and basil. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes.
Use an immersion blender to puree until smooth.
Stir in heavy cream and season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot with a drizzle of cream and fresh basil if desired.

title: Chicken Soup
description: The best chicken soup doesn’t need much — just tender poached chicken, hearty winter vegetables, and fresh herbs simmered in chicken broth. It’s a simple combination that’s a cozy hug for your taste buds and the best kind of immunity boost.

instructions.instruction: Saute the veggies. Heat the oil in a large pot on medium heat. Add the carrots, parsnips, celery, leek, and onion to the pot and cook for 4 to 5 minutes, stirring frequently. Add the garlic, salt, and pepper, and stir for another minute.
